cards.name: Fighting Cube 01
text: Flip a number of coins equal to the number of damage counters on this Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Float
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Chinchou.

cards.name: Forest Guardian
text: Shuffle your deck. Then, look at the top 7 cards of your deck. Choose 1 of those cards and put it into your hand. Shuffle the rest into your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Data Sort
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose a Trainer card in your discard pile, show it to your opponent, and then shuffle it into your deck.

attacks.name: Collect Fire
attacks.text: If there are any Energy cards in your discard pile, flip a coin. If heads, attach 1 of them to Vulpix.

attacks.name: Bubble
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Juggler
text: Discard up to 2 basic Energy cards from your hand. If you discarded 1 basic Energy card, draw 3 cards. If you discarded 2 basic Energy cards, draw 5 cards.

ability.name: Energy Return
ability.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you choose an Energy card attached to 1 of your Pokémon and return to your hand. This power can't be used if Espeon is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Damage Blast
attacks.text: Flip a number of coins equal to the number of damage counters on the Defending Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each heads.

cards.name: Elekid
text: If this Baby Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and your opponent tries to attack, your opponent flips a coin (before doing anything else required in order to use that attack). If tails, your opponent's turn ends without an attack.

attacks.name: Energy Kick
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, flip a coin. If heads, he or she chooses 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon and 1 Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon, if any. Attach that Energy card to that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Baby Outing
attacks.text: Look at the top 3 cards of your deck, and then choose 1 of those cards and put it in your hand. Shuffle the rest into your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Recover
attacks.text: Discard 1 Energy card attached to Tentacool in order to use this attack. Remove all damage counters from Tentacool.

attacks.name: Swift
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Time Shard
text: If the Pokémon this card is attached to is Knocked Out by damage from the Defending Pokémon's attack during your opponent's next turn, you may return up to 2 basic Energy cards attached to that Pokémon to your hand.

attacks.name: Thundershock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Reflect Energy
attacks.text: If you have any Benched Pokémon, take 1 basic Energy card attached to Ampharos, if any, and attach it to 1 of them.

attacks.name: Thundershock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Reflect Energy
attacks.text: If you have any Benched Pokémon and if there are any basic Energy cards attached to Ampharos, take 1 of those Energy cards and attach it to 1 of those Pokémon.

ability.name: Gluey Slime
ability.text: As long as Ariados is in play, each player must pay an additional Colorless to retreat his or her Active Pokémon. Gluey Slime can't make a player pay more than an additional Colorless to retreat a Pokémon, even if there is more than 1 Ariados in play.

attacks.name: Spider Force
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

ability.name: Bubble Turn
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Azumarill is on your bench, you may flip a coin. If heads, return Azumarill and all cards attached to it to your hand.

attacks.name: Aqua Sonic
attacks.text: Don't apply Resistance.

ability.name: Super Dynamo
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Electrode is your Active Pokémon, you may flip a coin. If heads, choose a Lightning Energy card from your discard pile and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon. This power can't be used if Electrode is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Swift
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

ability.name: Pure Body
ability.text: Whenever you attach a Fire Energy card to Entei from your hand, you must discard 1 other Energy card attached to Entei. (If you can't discard Energy cards, you can't attach the Fire Energy card.)

attacks.name: Burning Fang
attacks.text: You may flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned and you discard 1 Energy card attached to Entei.

ability.name: Sleep Pendulum
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Hypno is your Active Pokémon, you may use this power. The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep. This power can't be used if Hypno is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Spiral Aura
attacks.text: Unless this attack Knocks Out the Defending Pokémon, if your opponent has any Benched Pokémon you may choose 1 of them and switch it with the Defending Pokémon. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Miracle Tail
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose a Special Condition (Asleep, Burned, Confused, Paralyzed, or Poisoned). The Defending Pokémon is now affected by that Special Condition.

attacks.name: Roasting Heat
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Burned, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage.

ability.name: Miracle Shift
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), discard a basic Energy card attached to 1 of your Pokémon. Then, choose a basic Energy card from your discard pile and attach it to that Pokémon. This power can't be used if Togetic is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Mini-Metronome
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. Mini-Metronome copies that attack except for its Energy cost. (You must still do anything else required in order to use that attack.) (No matter what type the Defending Pokémon is, Togetic is still ). Togetic performs that attack.

attacks.name: Karate Chop
attacks.text: Damage from this attack is reduced by 10 for each damage counter on Primeape.

attacks.name: Sudden Charge
attacks.text: Primeape does 10 damage to itself. Then, switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon, if any.

ability.name: Anti
ability.text: Lightning - You can't attach Lightning Energy cards to Zapdos from your hand to Zapdos.

attacks.name: Plasma
attacks.text: If there are any Energy cards in your discard pile, flip a coin. If heads attach 1 of them to Zapdos.

attacks.name: Lightning Storm
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, put 2 damage counters on Zapdos.

attacks.name: Copy
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. Copy copies that attack. This attack does nothing if Sudowoodo doesn't have the Energy necessary to use that attack. (You must still do anything else required in order to use that attack.)

attacks.name: Energy Draw
attacks.text: Search your deck for a basic Energy card and attach it to Sudowoodo. Shuffle your deck afterward.

ability.name: Miracle Shift
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), discard a basic Energy card attached to one of your Pokémon. Then choose a basic Energy card from your discard pile and attach it to that Pokémon. This power can't be used if Togetic is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Mini-Metronome
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. Mini-Metronome copies that attack except for its Energy cost. (You must still do anything else required in order to use that attack.) (No matter what type the Defending Pokémon is, Togetic is still ). Togetic performs the attack.

attacks.name: Attract
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and switch the Defending Pokémon with it.

attacks.name: Deep Dive
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. For each heads, remove 1 damage counter from Wooper.

attacks.name: Stretch Tail
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and this attack does 10 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Skedaddle
attacks.text: Return Aipom and all basic Energy cards attached to it to your hand. If you have no Benched Pokémon, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Jolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Double Kick
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Triple Spin
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads. If you get 2 or more heads, switch Hitmontop with one of your Benched Pokémon, if any. .

attacks.name: Long Tongue
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance.

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

ability.name: Conductive Body
ability.text: You pay Colorless less to retreat Magnemite for each Magnemite on your Bench.

attacks.name: Magnetic Bomb
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage. If tails, Magnemite does 10 damage to itself.

cards.name: Grass Cube 01
text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep and Poisoned.

ability.name: Energy Return
ability.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may return an Energy card attached to 1 of your Pokémon to your hand. This power can't be used if Espeon is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Damage Blast
attacks.text: Count the number of damage counters on the Defending Pokémon. Flip that many coins. This attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each heads.

ability.name: Suction Cups
ability.text: As long as Octillery is your Active Pokémon, whenever the Defending Pokémon retreats, discard all Energy cards attached to the Defending Pokémon when it goes to the Bench.

attacks.name: Smokescreen
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Blot
attacks.text: Remove 1 damage counter from Bellsprout, if any.

attacks.name: Tickling Vines
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Double Kick
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Crystal Energy
text: Crystal Energy provides 1 Energy of all types (colors) of all basic Energy cards attached to the Pokémon Crystal Energy is attached to. If there are no basic Energy cards attached to the Pokémon Crystal Energy is attached to, Crystal Energy provides Energy.

cards.name: Memory Berry
text: The Pokémon this card is attached to can use any attack from its Basic Pokémon card or any Evolution card from which the Pokémon evolved. (You still have to pay for that attack's Energy cost.) Discard this card at the end of any turn the Pokémon attacks.

cards.name: Metal Cube 01
text: Before doing damage, you may choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and switch it with the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Seer
text: Look at the top 6 cards of your deck. Take all basic Energy cards you find there, show them to your opponent, and then put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Warp Energy
text: Warp Energy provides 1 Energy. When you attach Warp Energy from your hand to your Active Pokémon, switch your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Electrode is your Active Pokémon, you may flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 Lightning Energy card in your discard pile, if any, and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon. This power can't be used if Electrode is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Meditate
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

ability.name: Earth Rage
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Nidoking is your Active Pokémon, you may flip a coin. If heads, put a damage counter on each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. This power can't be used if Nidoking is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Giant Horn
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 50 damage plus 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Bursting Hand
attacks.text: Look at your opponent's hand. This attack does 10 damage times the number of Energy cards there.

attacks.name: Shuffle Attack
attacks.text: Look at a number of cards on top of your opponent's deck equal to the number of Energy cards attached to the Defending Pokémon. Put these cards in any order, and then put them back on top of your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Sleepy Ball
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Distortion Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Flail
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Seaking.

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Seaking.

attacks.name: Sleep Powder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a Energy card and attach it to one of your Benched Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Reverse Thrust

attacks.name: Flail

attacks.text: Discard a Energy card attached to Ponyta.

attacks.name: Splatter
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance.

cards.name: Darkness Cube 01
text: Before doing damage, discard all Trainer cards attached to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Energy Switch
text: Move a basic Energy card attached to 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon.

cards.name: Water Cube 01
text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance.

cards.name: Weakness Guard
text: As long as this card is attached, this Pokémon has no Weakness.

cards.name: Rainbow Energy
text: Attach Rainbow Energy to 1 of your Pokémon. While in play, Rainbow Energy provides every type of Energy but provides only 1 Energy at a time. (Has no effect other than providing Energy.) When you attach this card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon, put 1 damage counter on that Pokémon.

cards.name: Power Plant
text: Once during each of his or her turns, a player may discard a basic Energy card from his or her hand. If that player does, he or she chooses a basic Energy card from his or her discard pile, shows it to his or her opponent, and then puts it into his or her hand.

cards.name: Metal Energy (Special)
text: Damage done to the Pokémon Metal Energy is attached to is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance). If the Pokémon Metal Energy is attached to isn't , whenever it damages a Pokémon, reduce that damage by 10 (before applying Weakness and Resistance). Metal Energy provides Energy. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card.)

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage. If tails, this attack does 20 damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

ability.name: Magnetic Flow

If heads, choose 2 of your opponent's Pokémon that have Energy cards attached to them. Choose 1 of the Energy cards attached to each of those Pokémon and switch them between the Pokémon. This power can't be used if Magneton is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Steel Wave

attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to Lanturn. Flip a coin. If tails, Lanturn does 10 damage to itself for each Energy attached to it.

ability.name: Dark Moon
ability.text: As long as Umbreon is your Active Pokémon and has a Dark Energy attached to it, once during your turn (before your attack), you may look at your opponent's hand. Choose from it a number of cards up to the number of Dark Energy cards attached to Umbreon and shuffle them into your opponent's deck. Your opponent then draws the same number of cards from his or her deck. This power can't be used if Umbreon is affected by a Special Condition.
